intro: Bolelia pulchella f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered bolelia, is a rare and striking plant species characterized by its pale or white flowers. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its foliage is usually dark green with a slightly velvety texture. The white flowers bloom in clusters, adding a unique visual contrast to its dark leaves.
